articles.author: Sinead Cruise, Iain Withers
articles.description: Debt-laden companies across Europe, Middle East and Africa face a $500 billion refinancing scramble in the first half of 2024, a challenge that could kill off many "zombie" businesses even though an expected peak in rates could bring some relief.
articles.title: Fall of the zombies? Why corporate failures could surge in 2024

articles.author: Stephen Nellis, Max Cherney
articles.description: In a new front in the U.S.-China tech war, President Joe Biden's administration is facing pressure from some lawmakers to restrict American companies from working on a freely available chip technology widely used in China - a move that could upend how the global technology industry collaborates across borders.
articles.title: Exclusive: US-China tech war: RISC-V chip technology emerges as new battleground

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk-led Tesla (TSLA.O) on Friday cut prices for its Model 3 and Model Y vehicles in the U.S., according to the electric vehicle maker's website.
articles.title: Tesla slashes prices of Model 3, Models Y vehicles in US

articles.author: David French, Anirban Sen, Sabrina Valle
articles.description: Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) is in advanced talks to acquire Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD.N) in a deal that could value the Permian shale basin producer at about $60 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.
articles.title: Exxon in advanced talks for $60 billion acquisition of Pioneer, sources say

articles.author: Michael Derby
articles.description: The bond market tumult that has sent real-world borrowing costs surging is unlikely to deter the Federal Reserve from pressing onward with shedding nearly $100 billion of bonds each month from its $8 trillion balance sheet, analysts say.
articles.title: Bond rout won't end Fed balance sheet cuts, but endgame bubbling into view

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spanish startup PLD Space will attempt a test launch of its reusable Miura-1 rocket early on Saturday, spearheading a new generation of 'microlaunchers' after an aborted attempt in June.
articles.title: Spain's PLD Space counts down to test rocket launch from Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nestle (NESN.S) shares were under pressure on Friday as investors weighed the potential impact of Novo Nordisk's (NOVOb.CO) blockbuster weight-losing drug Wegovy and how it could reduce spending on food.
articles.title: Nestle shares at two-year low as investors weigh Wegovy rollout

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. job growth surged in September, suggesting that the labor market remains strong enough for the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates this year, though wage growth is moderating.
articles.title: US job growth beats expectations in September; unemployment rate unchanged at 3.8%

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: In a burial plot next to a field outside the remote Ukrainian hamlet of Hroza, residents removed undergrowth and cleared away litter to make space for more graves.
articles.title: 'Half the village is gone': Ukraine hamlet reels after missile strike

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: Forty-five allies of former U.S. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy are calling on their Republican colleagues for "fundamental changes" that would make it more difficult for a small faction to oust whoever may take his place.
articles.title: 45 U.S. House Republicans seek to prevent another speaker ouster
